name: issuance
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of supplying an official document, especially a financial product: The board approved Wednesday the issuance of revenue bonds to fund $250 million in capital improvement projects. He left the country this summer after the issuance of arrest warrants for him and his deputies.
More examplesFewer examplesIn the second quarter, the issuance of investment-grade bonds fell by 18 percent from the corresponding period the previous year.This year's issuance of preferred shares by US companies is on course to exceed the record $52.6bn touched last year.Officials said they have been working with Congress and the Department of Homeland Security to speed the issuance of immigrant visas.There will be public consultations in respect of the issuance of business licences to natural health practitioners.

FINANCE, STOCK MARKET →
issue noun : $715,000 was provided from the issuance of common stock.stock/bond issuance The firm plans to raise at least $500 million through a bond issuance denominated in dollars.
